Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
just did a `bailout` tx
```
./komodo-cli -ac_name=ROGUE cclib bailout 17 \"[%22b0a5eb81767b680563a26171a5e39124d012642e4c724c5f40af3b3ddf6bad43%22]\"
{
  "name": "rogue",
  "method": "bailout",
  "myrogueaddr": "R9dCYMKsDQRCg5CLpvThRser1gbBTmkEHG",
  "gametxid": "b0a5eb81767b680563a26171a5e39124d012642e4c724c5f40af3b3ddf6bad43",
  "hex": "HEX_VALUE",
  "txid": "36fadd76cdd4d2192a7f5821ad6070252c2a07961571198bbe0a596b94038f53",
  "result": "success"
}
```

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: @FishyGuts not as much as i'd like.   it's a new collaboration so results might vary.   although with the unity store asset pretty much out of the box simple GUI, it might be an easy integration but it might not be worth it.  multiple GUIs would be interesting though.   also what would be interesting is a % of ROGUE going to the cclib dev or a % going to the GUI dev.    with many GUIs, and with a popular game, it could really become a passionate contest of artwork etc.   add in some VR for the same game blockchain artifacts then you really have different experiences for everyone.   it's another new angle to amazing tech...

Author: jorian#4555
Content: @SHossain about the part in your guide where you set a new pubkey, there is an actual RPC called `setpubkey`. you don't have to restart the daemon anymore. so it's just a matter of `getnewaddress`, `validateaddress` and then `setpubkey <pubkey>` and you're good to go.
